channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16716] OfflineMetaRepair leaves empty directory inside /hbase/WALs which remains forever
item.description:
OfflineMetaRepair rebuild Meta table, while creating meta region it creates it's own WAL (inside /hbase/WALs/hbck-meta-recovery-<randomNumber>) which wll be closed and archived after rebuilding Meta. 

hbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.hbck.OfflineMetaRepair

    >> /hbase/WALs/hbck-meta-recovery-<randomNumber>

It doesn't clear the empty dir, empty directory should be removed after success.
item.summary: OfflineMetaRepair leaves empty directory inside /hbase/WALs which remains forever

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Ted Yu Can you please help here, why QA didn't run?
Thanks Ted Yu

lgtm


1391	   * @param walFactoryID A unique identifier for WAL factory. used i.e. by filesystem

i.e. means 'that is'
Did you intend to use 'e.g.' ?
Oh my bad. I just took it from WALFactory, will update this in another patch once QA execution is over.

-1 overall

Test case failures are not relevant.
Here also failed because of "java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space".
V2 patch, have updated the doc comment.

Can you provide patch for branch-1, if this needs to be fixed there ?

Thanks

FAILURE: Integrated in Jenkins build HBase-Trunk_matrix #1768 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-Trunk_matrix/1768/)
HBASE-16716 OfflineMetaRepair leaves empty directory inside /hbase/WALs (tedyu: rev 4d091166951a0b53e5fdd9dc694b4e5a12dc527c)

  • (edit) hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/util/hbck/TestOfflineMetaRebuildBase.java
  • (edit) hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/util/HBaseFsck.java

Have attached branch-1 patch.
Since branch-1 doesn't have HBASE-11983, so HBCK meta WAL directory has prefix as "hregion-" and followed by a random number.

In branch-1 patch retrieving WAL directory as,


    Path walLogDir = ((FSHLog) meta.getWAL()).getCurrentFileName().getParent();

Is this ok?

Test case failure is not relevant, locally it is successful.

Findbug warning is also not relevant, 

Return value of java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch.await(long, TimeUnit) ignored in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegionServer.initializeZooKeeper()
We should commit this in other branches (1.1/1.2/1.3) as well, IMHO.
